topNews.title: Bitcoin (BTC) Tests Multi-Week Support, Fantom (FTM) and Near Protocol (NEAR) Rally Further
topNews.description: Bitcoin remains just above an important level of support around $45.5k in dull trading conditions. Fantom and Near on the other hand are pushing ever higher.

authors.name: Nick Cawley
authors.title: Strategist
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2016</h2>  <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Analytical Profile: Technical and Fundamental </li> <li>Time Frame: Medium-Term (2 Days to 2 Weeks) </li> <li>Type: Event-Driven</li> </ul> <p><a href="/research/dna-fx">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>   <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>20 years  of experience trading fixed income products for a range of investment banks and brokers</li> <li>10 years  of experience analyzing and writing about fixed income and foreign exchange markets, including Dow Jones and the Wall Street Journal</li> <li>Present regular webinars and participate in market podcasts</li> <li>Spoken at a range of in-house conferences around the globe</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Education</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Financial futures trader</li> </ul>  <h2> <strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2>  <p>“You cannot change any market you trade in, but you can change the way you trade that market. Trading psychology and discipline is as important, if not more so, than fundamental and technical analysis and can help you ‘move the dial’ in your favor to become a better, more profitable, long-term trader.”</p>
authors.descriptionShort: At DailyFX Since: 2016. topNews.title: New Zealand Dollar May Keep Falling vs USD as Fed Rate Hike Bets Firm
topNews.description: The New Zealand may be setting up for losses after swelling Fed rate hike expectations pushed NZD/USD below a key near-term chart support barrier.

authors.name: Ilya Spivak
authors.title: Head Strategist, APAC
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2008</h2>  <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Analytical Profile: Technical and Fundamental</li> <li>Time Frame: Long-Term (Over 2 Weeks)</li> <li>Type: Position</li> </ul> <p><a href="/research/dna-fx">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>   <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>Over 15 years of experience applying a global macro approach to trading currencies</li> <li>Focused on market analysis and strategy since 2008 after 3 years across FX sales roles</li> <li>Work is regularly cited in Reuters, Bloomberg and other top financial media outlets</li> <li>Headlined trading conferences and expos in the US and across the Asia Pacific region</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Education</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Dual BA degree cum laude in Economics and International Relations from the University of California, Davis</li> </ul>  <h2> <strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2>  <p>“I come back time and again to this simple observation by Yra Harris: ‘If you’re right at the wrong time, you’re wrong.’ Its diligent application as a lens through which to view all market analysis and trading decisions has been a bedrock of my strategy for avoiding the common pitfalls that make profitability elusive for investors.”</p>
authors.descriptionShort: At DailyFX Since: 2008. Experience: Over 15 years of experience applying a global macro approach to trading currencies. Focused on market analysis and strategy since 2008 after 3 years across FX sales roles. Work is regularly cited in Reuters, Bloomberg and other top financial media outlets. Headlined trading conferences and expos in the US and across the Asia Pacific region.

eu.title: Euro Technical Analysis: Looking to Sell Rallies in EUR/GBP, EUR/JPY, EUR/USD
eu.description: Record COVID-19 infections, restrictions on travel, and a central bank in no hurry to raise rates make the Euro unappealing.

authors.name: Christopher Vecchio, CFA
authors.title: Senior Strategist
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2008</h2>  <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Analytical Profile: Technical and Fundamental</li> <li>Time Frame: Long-Term (2 weeks to 6 months)</li> <li>Type: Position</li> </ul> <p><a href=""/research/dna-fx"">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>   <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>Started trading in equities in 2004 and FX in 2008</li> <li>Has worked with DailyFX since attending college in 2008 starting with an internship</li> <li>Has consulted multi-national firms on FX hedging and has lectured at Duke Law School on FX derivatives trading</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Education</strong></h2> <ul> <li>B.A. in Economics & B.A. in Political Science from Lafayette College</li> <li>CFA charterholder as of August 2017</li> </ul>  <h2> <strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2>  <p>“Trading is about taking decisive action, but you need to be divorced from your emotions. Getting married to a position in the market is a result of many cognitive biases interfering with a sound trading and investment strategy. It’s important to remain objective and be willing to admit defeat as soon as the evidence accumulates against your favor. It’s better to take a small loss and admit you were wrong than take a big loss because you insisted that you were right.”</p>
authors.descriptionShort: At DailyFX Since: 2008. Experience: Started trading in equities in 2004 and FX in 2008. Has worked with DailyFX since attending college in 2008 starting with an internship. Has consulted multi-national firms on FX hedging and has lectured at Duke Law School on FX derivatives trading.

asia.title: US Dollar Jumps Up as Treasury Yields Leap on Fed Expectations. Where To From Here?
asia.description: The US Dollar index benefitted from the market raising bets on rate hikes by the Federal Reserve beyond what was already priced in. Will USD continue higher?
asia.newsKeywords: US Dollar, Treasury Yields, Fed, USD/JPY, ASX 200, NIKKEI 225, CSI 300

authors.title: Strategist
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2016</h2>  <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Analytical Profile: More Technical</li> <li>Time Frame: Medium-Term (2 Days to 2 Weeks)</li> <li>Type: Swing</li> </ul> <p><a href="/research/dna-fx">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>   <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>20 years of experience in trading and analysis in equities, futures, options, and FX</li> <li>Worked over a decade as a proprietary trader for Schonfeld, JGM Securities, and Torus Capital LLC, operating in several markets – equities/options, futures, interest rates, and FX. Worked at FXCM for 5 years in various analytical and trading roles.</li> </ul>  <h2> <strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2>  <p>“You could have the most insightful analysis and robust trading strategies, but if your mind isn’t ‘right’, then none of it will matter. authors.name: Diego Colman
authors.title: Market Analyst
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2016</h2>   <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>Analytical Profile: Technical and Fundamental</li>  <li>Time Frame: Long-Term (More than two weeks)</li>  <li>Type: Preference for swing trading</li> </ul> <p><a href="/research/dna-fx">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>  <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2>  <ul>    <li>More than 5 years trading forex, 7 years investing in equities</li>  <li>Has worked as a Latin American economist, covering Mexico, Argentina, Chile, Colombia and Brazil</li>  <li>Previously worked as an investment banking research analyst</li>  </ul> <h2><strong>Education</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>B.A. in Finance from Manhattanville College</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2> <p>"In many aspects of life, you stand to gain more when you focus on the process rather than the results. The same is true in trading. Take one step at a time, as you don't climb a mountain simply by looking at the top. Every trading system will have losses, but the important thing is to learn from mistakes so that over time your winning trades begin to consistently surpass your losing ones."</p>
authors.descriptionShort: At DailyFX Since: 2016. Experience: More than 5 years trading forex, 7 years investing in equities, Has worked as a Latin American economist, covering Mexico, Argentina, Chile, Colombia and Brazil, Previously worked as an investment banking research analyst
